bibl.title: New Menander Mosaics from Antioch.
bibl.note: A large mosaic pavement excavated in 2007 at ancient Daphne, a suburb of Antioch-on-the-Orontes, includes four figured panels representing scenes from comedies by Menander. Inscribed with the name of the play and the number of the act, the panels depict Perikeiromene, act 1; Philadelphoi, act 1; Synaristosai, act 1; and Theophoroumene, act 3. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: Kathryn Gutzwiller & Ömer Çelik, New Menander Mosaics from Antioch.
AJA 116 (2012) pp. 573-623, figg. n./bl. et coul.

A large mosaic pavement excavated in 2007 at ancient Daphne, a suburb of Antioch-on-the-Orontes, includes four figured panels representing scenes from comedies by Menander. Inscribed with the name of the play and the number of the act, the panels depict Perikeiromene, act 1; Philadelphoi, act 1; Synaristosai, act 1; and Theophoroumene, act 3. - Avec résumé en anglais.
